meanings.definition: An abnormal scar that grows beyond the boundaries of the original wound.
meanings.sent1: The cheloids on his arm were raised and itchy.
meanings.sent2: She had cheloids on her back from a previous surgery.
meanings.sent3: The cheloids seemed to have a mind of their own, growing bigger each day.
meanings.sent4: Her cheloids were like stubborn vines, refusing to fade away.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained that cheloids were different from regular scars due to their excessive growth.

meanings.definition: The plural form of cheloid, referring to multiple abnormal scars.
meanings.sent1: The patient had cheloids on various parts of his body.
meanings.sent2: After the accident, she was left with multiple cheloids.
meanings.sent3: The cheloids gathered together like a group of mischievous troublemakers.
meanings.sent4: In the dim light, her cheloids looked like tiny hills on her skin.
meanings.sent5: The mirror reflected back a sea of cheloids, each telling a different story of healing gone wrong.
